Class Ogre

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Character
      • logic.Ogre
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Ogre
extends Character
    Ogre, the second game level's enemy
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      His club's x-axis offset relative to his position

      To know if his club on the key's position (used to control its char representation)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ogre

        public Ogre(int startX,
            int startY)
        Constructor. Puts Ogre in his initial position with his club retracted (both offsets set to 0)
        Parameters:
        startX - Ogre's initial x-axis position
        startY - Ogre's initial y-axis position

    • Method Detail

      • getClubOffset

        public int[] getClubOffset()
        Gets the club's current offset relative to the Ogre's current position
        Returns:
        int array containing both offset values
        See Also:
        clubOffsetX, clubOffsetY

      • setClubOffset

        public void setClubOffset(int newOffsetX,
                          int newOffsetY)
        Sets the clube's offset to specific values (assumes values are valid, as in an adjacent position to the Ogre)
        Parameters:
        newOffsetX - Club's new x-axis offset
        newOffsetY - Club's new y-axis offset

        Raises the clubOnKey flag

        public void removeClubFromKey()
        Sets the clubOnKey flag back to false
        See Also:
        clubOnKey

      • clubIsOnKey

        public boolean clubIsOnKey()
        Checks if club is currently on the key's position through the clubOnKey flag
        Returns:
        true if clubOnKey is true, false otherwise
        See Also:
        clubOnKey

      • hasCaughtHero

        public boolean hasCaughtHero(int heroX,
                             int heroY)
        Checks if the Ogre's club has caught the Hero.
        Parameters:
        heroX - Hero's x-axis position
        heroY - Hero's y-axis position
        Returns:
        true if Ogre's club is near Hero, false otherwise
        See Also:
        clubSameCell, clubToTheLeft, clubToTheRight, clubUp, clubBelow

      • clubSameCell

                            int heroY)
        Checks if the Ogre's club is in the same cell as the Hero
        Parameters:
        heroX - Hero's x-axis position
        heroY - Hero's y-axis position
        Returns:
        true if Ogre's club is in the same cell, false otherwise

      • isStunned

        public int isStunned()
        Checks if the Ogre is currently stunned
        Returns:
        Number of turns left in which Ogre will still have the current stun (can be 0, 1 or 2)

      • setStun

        public void setStun()
        Stuns the Ogre

      • updateStun

        public void updateStun()
        Updates the current stun status (number of turns left gets smaller by a unit)

      • getNextMovement

        public int[] getNextMovement()
        Gets (a possible) next random movement for the Ogre if he's not stunned or a void one if he's stunned
        Returns:
        int array containing his possible next movement ([0,0] if currently stunned)

      • getNextClubMovement

        public int[] getNextClubMovement()
        Gets (a possible) next random club swing
        Returns:
        int array containing the next possible club offset in both directions
